intro: Chaetogastra fulvipilis, commonly known as the golden-haired chaetogastra, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features slender, hairy stems and produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and covered in fine, soft hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
